programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Barraclough ends her affair with Carl, prompting him to drunkenly confess to his brothers. Diane arranges work for Victoria, while Terry grows increasingly annoyed by Duke.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Carl realises Jimmy has taken him abroad, while Matthew issues a threat to Barraclough. Val catches Victoria with her cigarettes and Terry tells Duke to stay away from TJ.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ken pays a visit to old flame Denise and tells her he wants to meet his son Daniel. Whether the straight-talking hairdresser will agree is a different matter.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Leanne finally agrees to go out for a drink with Liam after shes finished seeing her new client. However, shes in for a big shock when she meets the punter in question.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: News of Martin and Louisas engagement spreads rapidly through the village, and Aunt Joan is annoyed to hear about it from Dave rather than her nephew. Al steps in to help as Bert struggles to keep the restaurant afloat, while the doctor is puzzled when he learns Beths knee replacement wound is failing to respond to the medication he prescribed. Comedy drama series, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor and Louisa make plans for their wedding, but the big day runs far from smoothly, as a drunken vicar leaves Martin with a dilemma. Meanwhile, the restaurant where the reception is to be held is flooded and Isobel goes into labour. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill and Gordons wedding day finally arrives, but a huge explosion at a nearby care home disrupts proceedings in spectacular fashion. As the Royal staff help pull the elderly residents out of the rubble, the horrifying truth about the cause of the accident is discovered. Starring Amy Robbins, Robert Daws and Paul Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina tries to kick-start her singing career by performing at a local nightclub, only to find herself accused of possessing drugs - which she suspects were planted in her handbag. Elsewhere, David responds to an unexpected windfall by making a very bad investment. Rural drama, starring Tricia Penrose and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Having dabbled in just about everything else under the sun, Greengrass develops a sudden interest in archaeology, convinced Aidensfield is full of buried treasures just waiting to be discovered. Unfortunately for him, the first items unearthed prove to be human remains, leading to fears that there is a murderer at large. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Perdy tells Grayson that Rosemary lied about his fathers death, before violently attacking her mother-in-law. Terry knocks Duke to the ground during an argument.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matthew tells Perdy the only way to escape hospital and get her life back is to pretend shes ill, while Andy is persuaded to give the goats a stay of execution.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul struggles to keep his mouth shut about his unexpected encounter with Leanne, while Ken sets off to meet Daniel - unaware hes being followed by Blanche - and Liz sets up a secret rendezvous with Derek.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul urges Liam to get rid of Leanne, so she hits back with a threat to the factory boss - if he says any more, shell tell Carla what he was up to the night before.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Since calling off his marriage to Louisa, Martin has begun to question what keeps him in Cornwall and realises that if he is ever to escape, he must conquer the blood phobia that ended his surgical career. Encouraged by aunt Joans friend Barbara he tackles his fear, but after an accident the pair end up in hospital, where he bumps into his girlfriend from medical school. Later, the return of a familiar face shakes him up even more. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Stephanie Cole and Lia Williams

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Despite the doctors unpleasant attitude toward her, Louisa applies for a job at the school - where she quickly notices something strange about the new headmasters behaviour. Martin refers Paulines aunt and uncle to Edith after they have trouble conceiving a baby, but her tests lead one of the couple to make a surprising confession. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with David Haig

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A couple who have recently returned to Aidensfield from Africa accuse their housekeeper of stealing, but Blaketon is more concerned about protecting their son from bullies. Meanwhile, Greengrass has a porker of a problem on his hands thanks to David, who accidentally buys some pigs at an auction on his behalf. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie refuses to believe her uncle could be responsible for a hit-and-run incident, despite the weight of evidence against him - a situation which puts her relationship with Mike to the test. Elsewhere, life in Aidensfield carries on much as normal, as Greengrasss greed causes a funeral to be a total wash-out. Rural drama, with Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Grace
programme.desc: The team investigates a case where nothing is ever as it first appears as an unidentified murder victim is found left out in the open countryside in curious circumstances. The post-mortem reveals more questions than it does answers, and as Grace works to identify the body, a chilling discovery in central Brighton suggests that a brazen killer is orchestrating an elaborate quest for vengeance

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sam is suspended from duty and decides to spend some time with his son, while Brooks and Leyton make a breakthrough when they discover who was responsible for the train crash and put the culprit under surveillance. Jake and Kate argue over whether it was right to prosecute Finn Tyler in his fragile mental state. Drama, starring Paul Nicholls and Bradley Walsh

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the childs grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty)

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam lead the investigation into the death of a wealthy woman whose body was dumped in the Thames. The team initially focuses inquiries on the victims abusive ex-husband, with whom she had been involved in a bitter struggle over custody of their daughter Holly, but the case heads in a different direction when the detectives discover the teenager was infatuated with her mothers new partner. With Patrick Baladi and an appearance by Bradley Walshs son Barney

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Will Theos real parents want him back or will the couples be able to sort things out amicably? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul begins to realise the extent of his feelings for Grayson, while Marlon fears the truth about the robbery will come out when he learns of Elis involvement with Debbie.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paul tries to stifle his feelings for Grayson. Diane struggles to put Billy behind her, and Marlon catches Eli smuggling stolen goods into the house.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre is furious when she discovers Ken spent the night at Denises, and wastes no time making her feelings known. Pauls hopes of avoiding Leanne are dashed when Carla invites her to dinner

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Denise attempts to put things straight between Ken and Deirdre - but all she achieves is a massive three-way argument in the Rovers. Fiz goes on a trip down memory lane with an old flame

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: PC Penhale is delighted by the arrival of his older brother Sam, but their reunion turns to misery when Martin delivers bad news to one of them. Louisa searches for a new home in the village and visits Edith for a check-up, where she reveals an embarrassing piece of information, and Al makes his situation with Pauline worse by trying to act on advice from Bert. Starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Al tries to raise some quick cash, and offers to sort out all Louisas household and plumbing problems if she can pay him promptly. The teacher gets good news on the employment front, and Martin accidentally inflicts a minor wound on an elderly patient - who responds by walking out of the surgery and vowing never to return. Drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Phyllida Law and Benjamin Whitrow

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina helps an old flame who goes AWOL from the Army and David ends up with more than egg on his face when Greengrass arranges a gourmet dinner at the pub. Nostalgic drama, starring Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield find themselves in the grip of a flu epidemic, putting baby Sam at risk. Meanwhile, Greengrass grudgingly finds himself helping the police retrieve an old friends stolen property, and Blaketons interference in the running of the pub drives Gina up the wall. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morses investigation into a number of untimely death notices in the Oxford Mail, each with a cryptic message, takes him to a series of funerals before forcing him to confront his own mortality. Thursday is facing more than one confrontation of his own as his past closes in on him, while he resorts to desperate measures to protect those he loves most. Final episode of the Inspector Morse prequel, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: An elderly woman is found dead in her flat after a break-in, leading Ronnie and Sam to suspect a burglary gone wrong. However, following a tip-off from the victims grand-daughter Connie, the detectives attention turns to live-in carer Cecile, who is promptly arrested. But the accused points the finger back at Connie, claiming she had been deliberately starving her grandmother. Who will the team believe? With Jan Francis, Daniel Casey and Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Following the brutal murder of a gay man, Sam and Ronnie embark on a desperate mission to track down the victims adoptive son, who has gone missing. The prime suspect soon emerges as the childs biological father - an alleged violent homophobe unable to stomach the idea of the youngster being brought up in a same-sex household - but was he acting alone? Guest starring Glynis Barber, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Return of the detective drama starring Bradley Walsh. Ronnie and new partner Joe lead the investigation into the death of jeweller Harry Bernstein, who has been found with his hands and teeth missing. His wife, her lover and a former business associate are all possible suspects, but the case takes a surprising turn when the victims sister receives a gruesome delivery. Shes on the jury for the trial of a drug dealer and murderer who Ronnie has been trying to nail for years, and the threat to her points to jury tampering, so Jake and Kate have to take a dramatic approach to win the case. The problem is, theyre up against a formidable defence barrister. Co-starring Ben Bailey Smith, Dominic Rowan and Georgia Taylor, with guests Helen Baxendale and Christopher Fulford

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie begin the fight to keep Theo, but its an expensive and painful process and the constant dredging up of their past starts to damage their relationship. programme.desc: Theo investigates a series of murders of staff at a psychiatric hospital. A doctor is convinced one of her patients is the killer, but Theo unearths another possibility

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Callum Hogg and Lauren Abrahams modern Park Hotel in Gloucestershire, where sisters Sue Lewis and Wendy Germann are impressed by the colourful decor, but its not an opinion held by all. The guests are not impressed with having to pay extra for breakfast and Callum and Lauren are faced with robust feedback that leaves them wanting answers and thinking not everyone is being fair

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Trowbridge in Wiltshire to Sues BandB, which is run by Sue Lewis and her sister, Wendy Germann. Breakfast at the communal table has its awkward moments and Sue is under pressure, having never cooked for so many before. However, its the feedback that leaves the hosts wondering if maybe some of the guests have not been that straightforward

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Talbot in Iwerne Minster, Dorset, for the third day of the competition, where hosts Erika Watt and Ellie Gill greet their guests. The rooms do not live up to their good first impression and Callum and Lauren are quick to find fault. At breakfast, tensions simmer as Wendy calls Cameron a creep, and at feedback, some of the comments send Erika and Ellie into fits of giggles

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit of the week is to The Old Rectory in Llangattock, south Wales, where young hotel manager Cameron Thomas likes to keep things professional. Despite wanting to find fault, Lauren and Callum are soon to admit their bridal suite is top notch, but Erika and Ellie think there may be some cleaning issues. During an afternoon of canoe racing the group members show their competitive sides

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. The Park Hotel in Gloucestershire is up first as owners Callum Hogg and Lauren Abraham want to get to the bottom of why Cameron didnt sleep soundly. Next, Sue Lewis from Sues BandB seeks to discover the deasons for Callum and Laurens low score for the cleanliness. When all issues are resolved, the winning establishment is revealed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on Andys Ford Pop hot rod, a 1950s car thats jam-packed with modifications - all of which, sadly, are bent, broken or riddled with rust

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend fix up one of the most iconic cars to come out of Germany, a BMW E30 Alpina. Its Mazs pride and joy but his ill health has prevented him from getting it back on the road

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil help househunters in Edinburgh. Phil meets Freya and Elliot who are moving from Aberdeen to the capital for the cultural buzz. Kirstie helps Edinburgh lass Sadia and Irishman Sohail find their first family home so they can finally move out of Sadias starter flat

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. Kirstie is with Laura and Euan, who have recently returned to their native Glasgow from Sydney. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. Phil has a wide brief with Miriam and David, who have spent eight months searching for their new home. He soon has success - the only problem is, they have each fallen for a different house

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Bolton-based bricklayer Paul Rimmer, who has spent his career restoring and renovating Victorian terrace houses, sets his sights on constructing a state-of-the-art home on a budget of £350,000. However, instead of using the construction materials he has spent the past 40 years mastering, he has opted to build his new home from wood. Roping in his wife Carol, daughter Abby and a selection of favoured workmates, Paul and his team begin work on the ultra-modern, five-bedroom build, and Kevin McCloud reveals how extreme weather, exhaustion, and rapidly dwindling funds place the entire project in jeopardy

programme.title: Our Welsh Chapel Dream
programme.desc: Keith Brymer Jones and Marj Hogarth set their sights on turning the old school room into their snug. Marj restores a baroque French chair, while fellow Pottery Throw Down judge Rich Miller helps Keith to make brutalist tiles for a feature wall. The couple take a break from forging the chapels future to visit the National Library of Wales to discover Capel Salems fiery past

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Peggy, 85, arrives at the hospital by ambulance, having injured her knee at home. Its the second time she has fallen in two months and medics want to find out if theres a more serious underlying cause. Meanwhile, the team keeps a close eye on 75-year-old Bob, who has had a suspected heart attack, and Ben, 25, isnt overly concerned by his swollen finger, until a doctor diagnoses cellulitis

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Staff nurse Graeme is attacked by a prisoner who has been brought to Kings College Hospital for treatment and the team has to restrain the patient before giving him the care he needs. Father-of-two Tony, 59, is rushed in by helicopter medics following a head-on traffic collision, 85-year-old Eric arrives with ongoing stomach problems and 79-year-old Jim, who is experiencing breathing difficulties, quickly strikes up a rapport with the female staff and muses on what it means to be a gentleman

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A paramedic heads to a serious traffic collision where a truck has overturned, while others deal with one of the most challenging emergencies - a cardiac arrest in the street.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Mick is put into an induced coma after suffering a cardiac arrest on a tennis court. Fell-runner Michael is seriously injured by cows in Cumbria. Plus, the helicopter medics face danger as they treat Adrian, whos been crushed by a collapsed wall

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Peggy, 85, arrives at the hospital by ambulance, having injured her knee at home. Its the second time she has fallen in two months and medics want to find out if theres a more serious underlying cause. Meanwhile, the team keeps a close eye on 75-year-old Bob, who has had a suspected heart attack, and Ben, 25, isnt overly concerned by his swollen finger, until a doctor diagnoses cellulitis

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple of bike lovers launch a new cycling business in Spain, while in France, a motorhome rental business deals with a busy day of bookings

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: In the Loire Valley, while Billie has a furniture renovation project to focus on, Ben faces a new challenge as he has to wallpaper for the very first time. Meanwhile, at Château de Sauge, the attic renovation project moves on to the next phase with the decoration of the 52-square-metre bedroom, but Paul is unconvinced by Donnas bold decor choices

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: In the Dordogne region, Abbie, Clive, Karen and Ross undertake a complicated project, by converting a car park into a new terrace and dining area. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At The Bluebell Woods in Northampton, David and Donna Bletsoe Brown try to bring a touch of class to their woodland BandB, but Fay Lahiani and Ray Cooper are on the warpath and are quick to discover a mucky mattress. Meanwhile, Marc Harris and Wayne Williams reveal their competitive streak during an afternoon of horse riding

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lion Hotel in Pontypool for the third day of the contest, where manager Marc Harris and head chef Wayne Williams aim to deliver a high end service. Although some of the guests are impressed by the rooms, Ray and Fay find it too small for the price, and simmering tensions between some of the competitors leads to a clash over dinner. At breakfast, Waynes food comes under fire, but it is David and Donnas feedback about finding a nail in their room that really rattles their hosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is the New Inn, Talgarth, where ex-naval officer Damon Lewis is the sole captain of his ship. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Karen and Richard have a large budget but no luck when it comes to making a deal, so they enlist the help of Kirstie Allsopp in their search for a family home in the West Midlands. Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. programme.title: Grand Designs

Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The fourth leg of their trip finds Steven Moore and Roo Irvine cruising around Lancashire. Magpie Roo takes a shine to a cameo ring, while king of ceramics Steven steers towards an unlikely buy of a hand-carved paddle. There is also great expectation for a Charles Dickens find. The experts find out how a local company brought rock and roll to the youth of Britain and learn how a brick from Accrington was used to construct some of the most iconic buildings in the world. The pair end their journey in Carnforth, enjoying a spot of auction watching in the grounds of Leighton Hall Estate

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Revisiting seven of the programmes most extraordinary searchers to discover how their lives have been transformed since finding their missing relatives. The first episode catches up with Joselyn Taylor, who had been searching for her brother James for over 20 years, and Roy Sibblies, who was looking for his birth mother after discovering at 18 that he was adopted

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell revisit more of the programmes most memorable searches, catching up with two women whose lives have been transformed in ways they never imagined. Those featured are Julie Roberts, who reunited with her birth mother Marion last year - leading to an incredible revelation. The second story follows Christina Barlow as she travels 5,000 miles to Colombia to spend time with the birth parents who gave her up in extreme circumstances, spending time with her full siblings who never knew she existed

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow three stories of siblings brought together after decades apart. Last year the programme introduced John Nicklin to four siblings on his birth mothers side, and in the meantime he has uncovered secrets on his fathers side of his family, leading to a whole new reunion. They also catch up brother and sister Tracey Collins and Christian Hilton, who reunited in 2014, as well as 81-year-old Pauline Wood as she prepares for her wedding day, with long-lost brother Colin set to give her away

programme.title: Ranger Hamzas Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how ivy plays an important role in the environment. They find out that ivy is an evergreen plant, so it provides shelter the whole year round to insects, birds and other animals. They learn that it can also be a food source for lots of creatures, like birds, which eat the ivys berries in winter. On the way, they walk like dinosaurs and spot a spider who has spun its web in the ivy.

programme.desc: The evolutionary biologist takes a train journey across the worlds oldest and greatest civilisation, starting at the very end of the Ancient Egyptian empire in Alexandria, before heading south to Cairo, Luxor and Aswan. Alice goes deep underground in search of Cleopatra, discovers how the Romans and the Greeks reacted to the treasures of Ancient Egypt and, on a visit to the site of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, she learns how a slave became a sultan and built his own fairy-tale caste

programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how butterflies and moths play an important role in the environment. They find out that they are fantastic pollinators who help to create habitats for other creatures to live. On the way, they get up close to a dragonfly and turn into Rambler butterflies!

programme.desc: In the penultimate episode of the supernatural drama, Hoyt is reminded of his past, while Bill pushes Sookie away and Eric faces a dilemma. Starring Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer and Alexander Skarsgard

programme.title: True Blood
programme.desc: The last-ever episode of the Louisiana-set supernatural drama brings Sookie Stackhouses tale full circle, as she once again finds herself contemplating a future without Bill. Eric and Pam struggle in their uneasy relationship with Mr Gus, and Sam makes a decision. Meanwhile, long-suffering Andy Bellefleur gains an unexpected inheritance. Starring Anna Paquin, Stephen Moyer, Alexander Skarsgard and Will Yun Lee

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Pembleton helps to cover up a scandal, only to find it coming back to haunt him. Gritty police drama, starring Andre Braugher, Daniel Baldwin and Richard Belzer

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Russert learns one of his former partners is being transferred back into Homicide. Pembleton chooses not to implicate the commissioner in the case that cost him his job. Gritty police drama, starring Daniel Baldwin, Ned Beatty and Richard Belzer

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Shae sneaks into Tyrions chamber to tell him Ros warned her about Baelishs interest in Sansa, who goes to tea with Margaery and her grandmother Lady Olenna and is encouraged to speak freely about Joffrey. Jaime passes the time by taunting his escort Brienne, Arya encounters outlaw group the Brotherhood Without Banners, while Lord Karstark makes Robb aware he no longer has faith in him. Fantasy drama, guest starring Diana Rigg

programme.title: Gomorrah
programme.desc: Enzo finally begins to enjoy all he has achieved, but the feeling does not last long. Meanwhile, Ciro looks for a ceasefire. In Italian

programme.title: Gomorrah
programme.desc: Genny sends Patrizia to agree terms of surrender, and he and Ciro go to explain the situation to Enzo, hoping he will listen to reason. In Italian

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Janice moves into her mothers house, Dr Melfi helps Tony probe his anxiety attacks, and Anthony Jr becomes the surprise star of his American football team. Gritty drama, starring James Gandolfini, Lorraine Bracco and Edie Falco

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Svetlana enlists Russian thugs in her conflict with Janice, and Ralph Cifaretto endears himself to Jackie Jr but loses points with Tony. Meanwhile, Dr Melfi is raped, but her attacker is freed on a technicality, leaving her facing a crisis of conscience. Gritty drama, starring James Gandolfini, Lorraine Bracco and Edie Falco

programme.title: The Wire
programme.desc: Tipped off by the wire, Greggs, Herc, Carver and Freamon intercept a drugs resupply in Franklin Terrace. Their success makes Avon and Stringer suspicious, leading them to rip out the payphones and close shop in the Pit. Bunk and McNulty trace another eyewitness to the Gant murder and ask Omar for help in tracking down their suspect

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: A restless Basilone is assigned to train new recruits after urging the army to give him a more active role, but finds himself becoming surprisingly close to a female sergeant at his new base. However, the pair are driven apart when he is called on to lead his trainees into battle on Iwo Jima. Second World War drama, based on the memoirs of US Marines who served in the conflict, starring Jon Seda and Annie Parisse

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Sansa grows in confidence under the watchful eye of the Machiavellian Lord Baelish, while Tyrion is after his just reward for the part he played in the Battle of the Blackwater. In the far North, Jon Snow is brought before formidable wildling leader Mance Rayder (Ciaran Hinds) and attempts to earn the trust of the King-beyond-the-Wall. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys Targaryen arrives in Slavers Bay with adviser Ser Jorah Mormont looking to form an army. Fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels, starring Peter Dinklage, Emilia Clarke and Kit Harington

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. Spring is in the air, and the town is a hive of activity as skippers return their pleasure yachts to the water after winter in the dry dock, while the pressure is on for Brixham to look its best for the arrival of Princess Anne, who will officially open the new £20million fish market, and the start of the summer season

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Childrens animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 4
programme.desc: Po returns to find and train a new dragon warrior,while a sorceress plans to summon all of his past enemies for revenge. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jack Black, Awkwafina, Viola Davis, Dustin Hoffman, Bryan Cranston and Ian McShane

programme.title: The Wild Robot
programme.desc: Following a shipwreck, a robot called Roz survives on an uninhabited island with the help of wild animals. Family animation, with the voices of Lupita Nyongo, Pedro Pascal, Kit Connor and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling koalas attempt to save his theatre with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates, while the finalists of the contest find that their lives will never be the same again. Animated comedy, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson, John C Reilly, Taron Egerton, Jennifer Saunders and Jennifer Hudson

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: A boy becomes obsessed with a sinister elderly neighbour living in a creepy old house. On Halloween night, he and two friends discover the chilling truth - the house is alive and eats anything that comes too close, including children. Animated comedy horror, with the voices of Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke, Steve Buscemi, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jason Lee

programme.title: Open Season
programme.desc: A mischievous deer tempts Boog, a domesticated grizzly bear with no survival skills, to try life on the wild side. However, with the hunting season in full swing, all the fearful woodland creatures urge Boog to unleash his inner ferocity and drive the gunmen out of the forest. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Martin Lawrence, Ashton Kutcher, Gary Sinise and Billy Connolly

programme.title: The Inventor
programme.desc: Leonardo Da Vinci explores the meaning of life with the help of a French princess. Stop-motion animated adventure, with the voices of Daisy Ridley, Marion Cotillard, Matt Berry and Stephen Fry

programme.title: The Swan Princess
programme.desc: A prince and princess have been expected to marry each other all their lives, a prospect they dreaded as children but which they came to look forward to as adults. However, an evil wizard captures the princess and turns her into a swan. Everyone else believes she is dead, but her betrothed sets out to bring her home. Animated adventure, with the voices of Michelle Nicastro, Jack Palance and John Cleese

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula opens a luxury resort for monsters, to provide a refuge from terrified humans. His cosy sanctuary is disrupted when a normal man unwittingly checks in, and the situation is complicated when the unwanted guest takes a liking to the counts daughter. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: The animal-loving family heads for Africa, where Eliza discovers unscrupulous poachers are plotting to kill an entire herd of elephants with the aid of a deadly electric fence, leaving her and ever-present pal Darwin to save the day. Animated adventure, with the voices of Lacey Chabert, Tim Curry, Tom Kane, Cree Summer, Lynn Redgrave and Jodi Carlisle

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling koalas attempt to save his theatre with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates, while the finalists of the contest find that their lives will never be the same again. Animated comedy, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson, John C Reilly, Taron Egerton, Jennifer Saunders and Jennifer Hudson

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: A raccoon trickster is fretting about his debt to a fearsome bear when he stumbles on some animals waking in the woods after their winter nap. Spotting the chance to solve his problem, the raccoon dupes the gullible creatures into stealing food from a nearby suburb so he can give it to the bear - but they fail to realise they will soon be at the mercy of a vermin exterminator. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bruce Willis, Steve Carell, Garry Shandling and William Shatner

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: A boy becomes obsessed with a sinister elderly neighbour living in a creepy old house. On Halloween night, he and two friends discover the chilling truth - the house is alive and eats anything that comes too close, including children. Animated comedy horror, with the voices of Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke, Steve Buscemi, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jason Lee

programme.title: Open Season
programme.desc: A mischievous deer tempts Boog, a domesticated grizzly bear with no survival skills, to try life on the wild side. However, with the hunting season in full swing, all the fearful woodland creatures urge Boog to unleash his inner ferocity and drive the gunmen out of the forest. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Martin Lawrence, Ashton Kutcher, Gary Sinise and Billy Connolly

programme.title: Rise of the Guardians
programme.desc: Magical beings from folklore, including Santa Claus, Jack Frost and the Easter Bunny, join forces to defeat the plans of an evil spirit, who intends to steal the dreams of children and use the power they grant him to dominate the world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Chris Pine, Alec Baldwin, Hugh Jackman, Isla Fisher and Jude Law

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Open Season 2
programme.desc: Wild dog Mr Weenie is kidnapped by a gang of family pets, who intend to brainwash him into returning to domesticated life, and his friends must make a perilous journey into human territory to save him. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Joel McHale, Jane Krakowski, Mike Epps, Billy Connolly and Crispin Glover

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: A raccoon trickster is fretting about his debt to a fearsome bear when he stumbles on some animals waking in the woods after their winter nap. Spotting the chance to solve his problem, the raccoon dupes the gullible creatures into stealing food from a nearby suburb so he can give it to the bear - but they fail to realise they will soon be at the mercy of a vermin exterminator. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bruce Willis, Steve Carell, Garry Shandling and William Shatner

programme.title: Deep Sea
programme.desc: Shenxiu was abandoned by her mother when she was a child. Since then, she has bad dreams about a monster called Nightmare. One day, she travels on a cruise ship with her family. On a stormy night, she falls and breaks into the fancy Deep Sea restaurant. She meets the Chef, Nanhe, and embarks on a mysterious journey. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Brian Flaccus and Angela Malhotra

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Mechs vs Mutants
programme.desc: The Dark Knight battles old enemies who have been transformed into giant monsters. Animated superhero adventure, with the voices of Roger Craig Smith and Oded Fehr

programme.title: Little Vampire
programme.desc: A budding friendship forms between a never-aging 10-year-old vampire and an orphan schoolboy, but a moon-headed monster throws obstacles in their paths. Animation, with the voices of Louise Lacoste, Camille Cottin and Jean-Paul Rouve

programme.title: The Cinema List: SNL
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film Saturday Night, the Cinema List explores 50 years of films from the SNL cast - including Waynes World, Bridesmaids and more.

programme.title: Coming 2 America
programme.desc: As King Jaffe Joffer, ruler of the prosperous nation of Zamunda, takes his final breath, pampered crown prince Akeem faces a constitutional crisis without a male heir to ascend the throne. An elderly shaman unexpectedly discloses that Akeem has an illegitimate son in New York. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: A portly Mexican friar working as a cook in an orphanage adopts the guise of a masked wrestler. He teams up with a thief and enters a tournament hoping to win enough money to sort out the monasterys financial problems, feed the kids under his care and impress the nun he is in love with. Comedy, starring Jack Black and Ana de la Reguera

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: A Cappella group the Barden Bellas enjoy an unprecedented run of success, until a disastrous performance sees them banned from national competitions and beset by scandal. They attempt to turn their fortunes around and redeem their reputation by competing in the World Championships of A Cappella in Copenhagen. Comedy sequel, starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson

programme.title: Youve Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rivals in the bookshop business fall in love over the internet, unaware they know and dislike each other in the real world. While things remain frosty in person, the pairs anonymous online relationship continues to blossom. Romantic comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, Greg Kinnear, Parker Posey and Dabney Coleman.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Two criminal brothers discover the orphanage where they were raised faces closure unless the nuns who run it can pay their tax bill, so the pair embark on an urgent mission to revive their old blues band to raise the money needed. Comedy, starring John Belushi, Dan Aykroyd, Aretha Franklin, James Brown, Ray Charles, Cab Calloway, Carrie Fisher, John Candy and John Lee Hooker

programme.title: Borat Subsequent Moviefilm
programme.desc: Borat returns from Kazakhstan to America intent on giving his fifteen year old daughter to the vice president. While on his mission, Borat also learns more about the American culture, the COVID-19 pandemic and political elections. Spoof documentary sequel, starring Sacha Baron Cohen

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: A family tragedy woos Delia Deetz, daughter Lydia and rebellious teenage granddaughter Astrid back to the close-knit community of Winter River. Astrid accidentally opens a portal to the afterlife by summoning Beetlejuice three times. The mischievous demon ricochets between realms, wreaking havoc wherever he goes. Tim Burtons comedy sequel, starring Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder and Jenna Ortega

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: A Cappella group the Barden Bellas enjoy an unprecedented run of success, until a disastrous performance sees them banned from national competitions and beset by scandal. They attempt to turn their fortunes around and redeem their reputation by competing in the World Championships of A Cappella in Copenhagen. Comedy sequel, starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road
programme.desc: More than a decade on from his appearance in documentary series The Office, a film crew is once again following the life of David Brent. He is now working as a rep for a cleaning-goods distributor, but harbours dreams of making it big in the music business. Acting on this, he takes three weeks off work and tours with a new-look version of Foregone Conclusion, the band he fronted in the 1990s. Mockumentary comedy, starring Ricky Gervais, Ben Bailey Smith and Tom Basden.

programme.title: Anyone But You
programme.desc: Bea and Ben enjoy an incredible first date, but attraction quickly burns out and they are delighted to be apart. However, fate compels the duo to reconsider, and they seize the opportunity to attend a lavish wedding in Australia, as a couple. The pair pretend to be deliriously in love during the once-in-a-lifetime trip and keep up appearances in front of other guests. Director Will Glucks romantic comedy based on Shakespeares Much Ado About Nothing, starring Sydney Sweeney and Glen Powell

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: When New York University professor Rachel Chu heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, Nick Young, shes surprised to learn hes from an extremely wealthy family. The problem is they arent so approving of her, so she attempts to win them over. Blockbusting comedy based on Kevin Kwans novel, starring Constance Wu, Henry Golding, Gemma Chan and Michelle Yeoh

programme.title: Running on Empty
programme.desc: When Mort discovers he has less than a year to live, and his fiance leaves him, the hapless soul meets a woman who is also set to die on the same day as him. Writer/director Daniel Andres comedy, starring Keir Gilchrist, Lucy Hale, Dustin Milligan and Monica Potter

programme.title: Your Monster
programme.desc: After her life crumbles, a soft-spoken actress finds her voice again when she meets the monster living in her closet. Romantic comedy, starring Melissa Barrera, Tommy Dewey, Edmund Donovan and Meghann Fahy

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: A power-crazed bully, a sleazy cocaine addict and a sexual predator each make an employees life a misery, but the three workers cannot afford to quit their jobs. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each others bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3
programme.desc: Following their win at the world championship, the now-separated Bellas (an all-female a cappella singing group) reunite for one last singing competition at an overseas USO tour. However, they face a squad who uses both instruments and voices. Final part of the blockbusting comedy trilogy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Brittany Snow

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: Two irresponsible salesmen find themselves in trouble with the law after crashing their truck. To avoid jail, they agree to undertake community service looking after a couple of troubled kids. However, it soon seems that going to prison would have been the easier option. Comedy, starring Paul Rudd, Seann William Scott and Christopher Mintz-Plasse

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: A private eye is recruited by a group of Buddhist mystics and sent on a mission to rescue an abducted boy whose supernatural powers will enable him to bring about world peace. However, the kidnapper is actually a demon in human form, determined to ensure the youngster does not fulfil his destiny. Comedy fantasy adventure, starring Eddie Murphy, Charles Dance and Charlotte Lewis

programme.title: Yesterday
programme.desc: Jack, a struggling musician, gets hit by a bus during a mysterious event. When he regains consciousness, he finds that he is the only person who can remember the Beatles, and sets out to exploit the opportunity by passing their hits off as his own compositions. Danny Boyles comedy, starring Himesh Patel and Lily James

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: High school outcasts Janis Sarkisian and Damian Hubbard narrate the tale of 15-year-old Cady Heron, who moves back to America from Kenya with her mother. Janis encourages Cady to infiltrate the Plastics, ruled by the formidable Regina George, but when she does, the clique soon corrupts the new girl. Musical adaptation of the 2004 cult classic, starring Angourie Rice, Renee Rapp, Aulii Cravalho, and Tina Fey, who also wrote the screenplay

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3
programme.desc: Following their win at the world championship, the now-separated Bellas (an all-female a cappella singing group) reunite for one last singing competition at an overseas USO tour. However, they face a squad who uses both instruments and voices. Final part of the blockbusting comedy trilogy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Brittany Snow

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rivals crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: A veteran lifeguard commands a highly trained team that keeps the sun-kissed resort of Emerald Bay safe. As he breaks in some new recruits - including an insubordinate former Olympic swimmer - he has to contend with a dangerous new drug sweeping the beach. Action comedy based on the TV series, starring Dwayne Johnson, Zac Efron, Alexandra Daddario and Priyanka Chopra

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: A mischievous rabbit has the run of a farm and its vegetable patch when the owner unexpectedly dies. When a relative inherits the property, he strives to rid his land of the rabbit and his woodland friends - but his feelings for a nature-loving woman complicate the battle of wits with the animal kingdom. Family comedy based on Beatrix Potters stories, starring Domhnall Gleeson and Rose Byrne, with the voices of James Corden and Margot Robbie

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in a parallel universe populated by magical and menacing characters. When her best friend becomes the latest in a long line of children to mysteriously vanish, she embarks on a perilous mission to uncover the dark secret behind their disappearance. Fantasy adventure based on Philip Pullmans novel Northern Lights, starring Dakota Blue Richards, Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig and Eva Green. Featuring the voices of Ian McKellen, Kristin Scott Thomas and Kathy Bates

programme.title: Blithe Spirit
programme.desc: A spiritualist medium holds a seance for a writer suffering from writers block, but accidentally summons the spirit of his deceased first wife. That leads to an increasingly complex love triangle with his current spouse of five years. Director Edward Halls take on the Noel Coward comedy, starring Isla Fisher, Dan Stevens and Leslie Mann

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A hi-tech computer chip has a bizarre effect on a squad of toy soldiers, causing mayhem for their owner as the miniature marauders engage in a series of scaled-down skirmishes. Childrens adventure mixing live action and computer animation, starring Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary and Gregory Smith, with the voices of Tommy Lee Jones, Frank Langella, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Christina Ricci

programme.title: Ella Enchanted
programme.desc: In a fantasy world where a fairy godmother endows each newborn with a special attribute, baby Ella is given the unwelcome gift of obedience. While growing up, she is magically compelled to do anything she is told to, and her stepmother takes great delight in forcing the girl to obey her every whim. So Ella sets out on a quest to find her fairy godmother and get her to take back her unwanted birthright. Fantasy adventure, starring Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Minnie Driver and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventure, starring Zachary Levi, Lil Rel Howery, Zooey Deschanel and Benjamin Bottani

programme.title: Mr Beans Holiday
programme.desc: The bumbling fool wins first prize in the church raffle - a trip to France and a video camera. His travels cause chaos as he disrupts a film shoot in Cannes, to the fury of its megalomaniac director, and is then accused of kidnapping a youngster. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Willem Dafoe, Emma de Caunes and Max Baldry

programme.title: Cats and Dogs
programme.desc: In his quest for world domination, a power-mad Persian cat plots to sabotage a scientists plans to cure all humans who are allergic to dogs. A heroic puppy joins a force of canine secret agents to foil his schemes. Comedy, starring Jeff Goldblum and Elizabeth Perkins, and featuring the voices of Tobey Maguire, Alec Baldwin, Susan Sarandon and Sean Hayes

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3
programme.desc: The blue hedgehog, Knuckles and Tails reunite to face the might of the villainous Shadow, who possesses powers unlike anything they have seen before. Outmuscled on every front, Sonic seeks help from an unlikely source, Dr Ivo Robotnik. Fantasy adventure sequel based on the videogame, starring Jim Carrey, James Marsden and Tika Sumpter

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald

programme.title: Pups United
programme.desc: A childrens football team competes in a world championship, but one member is left off the field to look after the canine mascot. When an evil plot emerges to sabotage the tournament, the quick-witted dog assembles the other mascots into a team to foil the villains responsible. Family adventure, starring Matthew James Roberts and Kristin Carey, with the voice of Rob Schneider

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: Two Second World War evacuees face a dilemma when they meet a German pilot who has been shot down. Family drama, starring John Bardon and Stacey Tendeter

programme.title: Jackie Chans The Tuxedo
programme.desc: A bumbling chauffeur steps in to take the place of a secret agent injured in an explosion. Wearing the agents hi-tech suit, and with the help of a rookie spy, the humble driver now has all the power he needs to stop a villain from gaining global domination by polluting the worlds water supply. Comedy adventure, starring Jackie Chan, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs and Richie Coster

programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventure, starring Matthew James Roberts and Kristin Carey, with the voice of Rob Schneider

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: Two Second World War evacuees face a dilemma when they meet a German pilot who has been shot down. Family drama, starring John Bardon and Stacey Tendeter

programme.title: Save the Cinema
programme.desc: Drama telling the true story of Liz Evans from Carmarthen, south-west Wales, who started a campaign in the 1990s to save the towns Lyric Cinema. With the help of local politician Richard Goodridge, Liz manages to persuade Steven Spielberg to show a premiere of Jurassic Park at the Lyric. Starring Samantha Morton, Tom Felton and Jonathan Pryce

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3
programme.desc: The blue hedgehog, Knuckles and Tails reunite to face the might of the villainous Shadow, who possesses powers unlike anything they have seen before. Outmuscled on every front, Sonic seeks help from an unlikely source, Dr Ivo Robotnik. Fantasy adventure sequel based on the videogame, starring Jim Carrey, James Marsden and Tika Sumpter

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: A reporter discovers four humanoid amphibians who live in the sewers of New York, and use their martial arts skills to fight crime. She helps them as they face their toughest challenge yet - defeating a sinister criminal organisation that seems to have power over the entire city. Fantasy adventure, starring Megan Fox and William Fichtner, with the voice of Johnny Knoxville

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star in question is in fact a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaimans novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: Two Second World War evacuees face a dilemma when they meet a German pilot who has been shot down. Family drama, starring John Bardon and Stacey Tendeter

programme.title: Jackie Chans The Tuxedo
programme.desc: A bumbling chauffeur steps in to take the place of a secret agent injured in an explosion. Wearing the agents hi-tech suit, and with the help of a rookie spy, the humble driver now has all the power he needs to stop a villain from gaining global domination by polluting the worlds water supply. Comedy adventure, starring Jackie Chan, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs and Richie Coster

programme.title: Big Fat Liar
programme.desc: A 14-year-old with a reputation for tall tales loses the sole copy of a story he has written for school - only for it to end up in the hands of a Hollywood producer. When the youngster realises it has been made into a blockbuster movie, he goes to Los Angeles with his best friend to claim a fair share of the profits - but when the movie executive refuses to do the right thing, they plan a fitting revenge. Comedy, with Frankie Muniz, Paul Giamatti and Amanda Bynes

programme.title: A Tigers Journey
programme.desc: In the valleys of the Himalayas, an orphan boy saves a Bengal tiger cub from the poachers who killed the creatures mother. Together they head for a monastery in Bhutan known as the Tigers Nest, where Buddhist monks took refuge after the 1950 Chinese invasion of Tibet and protect the big cats. Drama, starring Sunny Pawar, Claudia Gerini and Amandeep Singh

programme.title: The Mountain
programme.desc: Sam, a fearless young girl raised outside of her Maori culture, is determined to connect with a mountain in the hope it can cure her cancer. Along the way she meets new friends Mallory and Bronco. Co-writer/director Rachel Houses comedy, starring Elizabeth Atkinson, Reuben Francis, Terence Daniel and Byron Coll

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomons diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichtons novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitlers plans for world domination - aided by Joness deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist, with his young sidekick and a nightclub singer in tow, is stranded in India, where he takes on a mission to recover magical sacred stones from the hands of an evil cult engaged in human sacrifice and child slavery. Steven Spielbergs action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead mans revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancys novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Schindlers List
programme.desc: In German-occupied Poland during the Second World War, businessman and Nazi Party member Oskar Schindler is deeply affected when he witnesses the clearing of the Krakow Ghetto. He decides to try to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielbergs Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: An ageing secret service agent, tormented by his failure to save the life of John F Kennedy in 1963, is drawn into a battle of wits with a sinister CIA-trained assassin out to kill the current president. As the day of reckoning draws closer, the agents nerves are tested to the limit - and nothing seems to be going his way. Wolfgang Petersens thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever
programme.desc: A streetwise Brooklyn teenager struggles to cope with a dead-end job and a dysfunctional family. However, he finds an escape in the disco scene, where he falls in love with a woman dreaming of breaking free from her equally poor background to pursue a brighter future in Manhattan. Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppolas gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michaels story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppolas Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale and Lee Strasberg

programme.title: The Godfather: Part III
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his familys Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Francis Ford Coppolas crime drama sequel, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach and Bridget Fonda

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead mans revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancys novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: An ageing secret service agent, tormented by his failure to save the life of John F Kennedy in 1963, is drawn into a battle of wits with a sinister CIA-trained assassin out to kill the current president. As the day of reckoning draws closer, the agents nerves are tested to the limit - and nothing seems to be going his way. Wolfgang Petersens thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind, hard-drinking war veteran pays a timid college student to accompany him on a weekend break in the big city, where he plans to make the most of life. However, the youngster is shocked to learn that at the end of their trip, his new friend plans to kill himself. Comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Al Pacino, Chris ODonnell, Gabrielle Anwar and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Rachel Marron, a famous singer and actress is subjected to death threats by an obsessive fan and persuaded to hire a former secret service agent as her bodyguard. However, neither she or her new minder realise the effect they are about to have on each others lives. Romantic thriller directed by Mick Jackson, starring Kevin Costner, Whitney Houston, Gary Kemp and Bill Cobbs

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: Helm Hammerhand sits on the throne of Rohan, flanked by sons Hama and Haleth and rebellious daughter Hera. Dunlending lord Freca proposes a marital union between Hera and his son Wulf, which Helm loudly rejects. In a subsequent brawl between fathers, Helm unintentionally lands a fatal blow, so Wulf vows revenge and amasses an army led by General Targg. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gaia Wise, Brian Cox, Luke Pasqualino and Lorraine Ashbourne

programme.title: Die Alone
programme.desc: A young couple flee the city during a zombie outbreak, only to be involved in a car crash. When the man awakes, his girlfriend is missing, so he bands together with a rugged survivalist to find his partner - but he only has selected memories of what he has been through. Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: In 1838 Germany, Thomas Hutter is sent to the Carpathian mountains to secure the signature of enigmatic nobleman Count Orlok on a property sale in the German city of Wisborg. Thomas leaves his bride Ellen in the care of friend Friedrich Harding and his wife Anna. The young man barely survives the exhausting trip to Europe and stumbles home to find Ellen driven to delirium by a telepathic bond to the Count. Director Robert Eggers version of the Dracula-inspired horror, starring Bill Skarsgard, Lily-Rose Depp, Nicholas Hoult and Aaron Taylor-Johnson

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon

programme.title: Restless
programme.desc: A middle-aged empty nesters mundane life is upended when raucous new neighbours move in next door, unleashing potential danger and disruption. Writer/director Jed Harts thriller, starring Lyndsey Marshal and Declan Adamson

programme.title: Amongst the Wolves
programme.desc: An ex-soldier meets a teen fleeing a gang, an encounter which forces them to confront their pasts while navigating present realities. Director Mark OConnors thriller, starring Luke McQuillan, Aidan Gillen and Daniel Fee

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: In 1838 Germany, Thomas Hutter is sent to the Carpathian mountains to secure the signature of enigmatic nobleman Count Orlok on a property sale in the German city of Wisborg. Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray

programme.title: Spin the Bottle
programme.desc: When a group of friends play spin the bottle in a house marked by a brutal massacre, they unknowingly unleash an evil spirit and start dying in terrifying ways. The survivors must stick together to uncover the houses secrets and end the bloodshed. Horror starring Tanner Stine and Kaylee Kaneshiro

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: When a couple flee Europe in 1947, their new lives in the US are changed by a strange client. Director Brady Corbets drama, starring Adrien Brody, Felicity Jones, Guy Pearce and Joe Alwyn

Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gaia Wise, Brian Cox, Luke Pasqualino and Lorraine Ashbourne

programme.title: Into the Wonderwoods
programme.desc: Young Angelo dreams of becoming an explorer and a zoologist. When he goes to visit his granny, his parents leave him behind at a rest stop, and he decides to cut through the forest in search of them. Animated adventure, featuring the voice of Kristen McGuire

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon
