The survivors must stick together to uncover the houses secrets and end the bloodshed. Horror starring Tanner Stine and Kaylee Kaneshiro

programme.title: Timestalker
programme.desc: A woman is condemned to squander her life in pursuit of a man who does not return her admiration, and she only comes to her senses after lingering briefly in heavenly limbo. Fantasy comedy, written, directed by and starring Alice Lowe, with Jacob Anderson, Nick Frost and Tanya Reynolds

programme.title: Lovely, Dark and Deep
programme.desc: A ranger travels alone through the dangerous wilderness, hoping to uncover the origins of a tragedy that has haunted her since she was a child. Writer/director Teresa Sutherlands horror, starring Georgina Campbell and Nick Blood

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

programme.title: If You Were the Last
programme.desc: Adrift in their broken shuttle with little hope of rescue, two astronauts argue over whether theyre better off spending their remaining days as friends or something more. Romantic comedy, starring Anthony Mackie and Zoe Chao

programme.title: Dune: Part Two
programme.desc: On the desert planet Arrakis, freedom fighters Paul and Chani galvanise the Fremen to strike down murderous conspirators against the Atreides dynasty. Sci-fi drama based on Frank Herberts acclaimed novel, starring Timothee Chalamet, Zendaya, Austin Butler and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent DOnofrio

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Insidious
programme.desc: A family experience strange events in their house and become convinced it is haunted. However, after moving on, they find the dark forces have followed them and when their son mysteriously falls into a coma, they must find a way to get rid of the paranormal entities tormenting them. Horror, starring Patrick Wilson and Rose Byrne

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc: A couple previously tormented by paranormal activity discover their nightmares are not over. As more strange events occur, they turn to a group of paranormal investigators for help in uncovering the dark secrets that connect them to the spirit world. Horror sequel, starring Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne and Barbara Hershey

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Maverick film-maker Carl Denham and his cast and crew board a ship bound for a mysterious island - but when they arrive, a giant gorilla carries off their leading lady, Ann Darrow. As the crew makes its way through the teeming jungle to find her, the director concocts a dangerous scheme to capture the great ape and take it back to New York. Peter Jacksons remake of the fantasy adventure, starring Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody and Andy Serkis, in a dual role as the ships cook and motion-captured creature

programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: A brilliant scientist tests an invisibility serum on himself, but becomes dangerously intoxicated by the power he acquires. He abandons his morals and heads out into the city to take full advantage of his condition. Realising he has been up to no good, concerned colleagues decide to confront him - with terrible consequences. Paul Verhoevens sci-fi thriller, starring Kevin Bacon, Elisabeth Shue, Josh Brolin and Kim Dickens

programme.title: The Watched
programme.desc: Mina, a 28-year old artist, gets stranded in an expansive, untouched forest in western Ireland. When Mina finds shelter, she unknowingly becomes trapped alongside three strangers that are stalked by mysterious creatures each night. Horror, starring Dakota Fanning, Georgina Campbell and Olwen Fouere

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Maverick film-maker Carl Denham and his cast and crew board a ship bound for a mysterious island - but when they arrive, a giant gorilla carries off their leading lady, Ann Darrow. As the crew makes its way through the teeming jungle to find her, the director concocts a dangerous scheme to capture the great ape and take it back to New York. Peter Jacksons remake of the fantasy adventure, starring Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody and Andy Serkis, in a dual role as the ships cook and motion-captured creature

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man
programme.desc: A scientists ill-advised experiments with virtual reality equipment transform a mentally handicapped gardener into a computer-enhanced megalomaniac with the power to make his dreams of world domination come true. Sci-fi thriller, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Geoffrey Lewis and Austin OBrien

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Passengers
programme.desc: A spacecraft transporting thousands of people to a distant planet malfunctions. As woken travelling companions Jim Preston and Aurora Lane fall in love, they are soon on a collision course with more technical problems and a dark secret. Sci-fi drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt and Michael Sheen

programme.title: Abigail
programme.desc: Six strangers are recruited to abduct 12-year-old Abigail from her family home and spirit the youngster to a remote location, Wilhelm Manor. They must hold her hostage for 24 hours to earn a huge ransom. However, the cash-hungry sextet are unaware that their captive is a vampire. Horror, starring Melissa Barrera, Dan Stevens, Alisha Weir and Kathryn Newton

programme.title: The Invisible Man
programme.desc: An abused woman flees for her life and takes refuge with a family. It later appears that Cecilia Kasss ex has killed himself and shes due to inherit a fortune, but the fact he was experimenting with an invisibility suit makes her think hes come after her. Thriller, starring Elisabeth Moss, Oliver Jackson-Cohen and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Rashomon
programme.desc: Acclaimed Japanese director Akira Kurosawas Oscar-winning thriller focusing on three eyewitnesses highly personal accounts of a rape and murder, which reveal the true characters and frailties of those involved. Toshiro Mifune, Machiko Kyo and Masayuki Mori star

programme.title: Melancholia
programme.desc: A jaded German ex-pat living in London is confronted by his past as a member of a far-left radical group when hes asked to assassinate a Chilean murderer who is visiting London. Drama, starring Jeroen Krabbe and Susannah York

programme.title: Detroit
programme.desc: A group of rogue police officers responds to a complaint with apparent retribution rather than justice in mind, launching a raid on a group of African-Americans. Public anger reaches a peak after the incident, as relationships sour with authority. Fact-based drama set during the 1967 Detroit riots, starring John Boyega, Anthony Mackie and Algee Smith

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Manns thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Rashomon
programme.desc: Acclaimed Japanese director Akira Kurosawas Oscar-winning thriller focusing on three eyewitnesses highly personal accounts of a rape and murder, which reveal the true characters and frailties of those involved. Toshiro Mifune, Machiko Kyo and Masayuki Mori star

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangsters accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his bosss millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchies crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: The FBI agent who first captured Hannibal Lecter is called out of retirement to catch a demented murderer dubbed the Tooth Fairy, who slaughters a family whenever there is a full moon - forcing the detective to draw on the imprisoned cannibals expertise in criminal psychology. Thriller prequel adapted from the first of Thomas Harriss Lecter novels, starring Anthony Hopkins, Edward Norton, Ralph Fiennes and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: Crank
programme.desc: An assassin faces a race against time when he learns a rival has poisoned him with a drug that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. As he sets out to take revenge on his enemies, he has to resort to increasingly desperate acts to keep his adrenaline pumping. Action thriller, with Jason Statham, Amy Smart and Jose Pablo Cantillo

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowes remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original

programme.title: The Line
programme.desc: A university student attempts to live his life without a fear of consequences. Co-writer/director Ethan Bergers drama, starring Alex Wolff, Lewis Pullman and Bo Mitchell

programme.title: Melancholia
programme.desc: A jaded German ex-pat living in London is confronted by his past as a member of a far-left radical group when hes asked to assassinate a Chilean murderer who is visiting London. Drama, starring Jeroen Krabbe and Susannah York

programme.title: Dangerous Waters
programme.desc: A sailing trip turns into a nightmare when a woman uncovers the dark past of her mothers new boyfriend. Thriller, starring Odeya Rush, Eric Dane, Saffron Burrows and Ray Liotta in one of his final films

programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker
programme.desc: The captain of Russias first nuclear submarine is demoted for expressing fears that the vessel is unfit for commission. However, his anxieties prove well-founded when the reactor malfunctions, creating the possibility of a nuclear explosion the US would mistake for an attack - and potentially triggering a global conflict. Kathryn Bigelows fact-based thriller, starring Harrison Ford, Liam Neeson and Peter Sarsgaard

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangsters accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his bosss millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchies crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: The FBI agent who first captured Hannibal Lecter is called out of retirement to catch a demented murderer dubbed the Tooth Fairy, who slaughters a family whenever there is a full moon - forcing the detective to draw on the imprisoned cannibals expertise in criminal psychology. Thriller prequel adapted from the first of Thomas Harriss Lecter novels, starring Anthony Hopkins, Edward Norton, Ralph Fiennes and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: Eileen
programme.desc: In 1960s Massachusetts, twenty-something shrinking violet Eileen Dunlop works as a secretary at a juvenile detention centre. The mundanity of her life is shattered by the arrival of alluring psychologist Dr Rebecca St John, but matters soon take a disturbing turn. Director William Oldroyds thriller, starring Thomasin McKenzie and Anne Hathaway

programme.title: The Perfect Storm
programme.desc: The skipper of a fishing boat and his crew ignore severe weather warnings and head for a dangerous area of the North Atlantic in search of the last lucrative catch of the season, but end up fighting for survival in the worst storm of the 20th century. Fact-based disaster drama, with George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Diane Lane, John C Reilly and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio.

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Maverick San Francisco detective Dirty Harry Callahan sets out to capture a deranged sniper picking off victims at random. Don Siegels thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino and Andy Robinson

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancys novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones

programme.title: Angels and Demons
programme.desc: Academic adventurer Robert Langdon is called in by the Vatican to deal with a crisis. Pope Pius XVI has died suddenly and the four cardinals in line to be his successor have all been abducted by a mysterious sect that is threatening to murder them. As he searches for the kidnapped clerics, Langdon discovers the cult has an even more horrific plan in mind involving a stolen canister of anti-matter. Ron Howard takes the reins once again for the sequel to The Da Vinci Code, with Tom Hanks, Ewan McGregor, Ayelet Zurer, Stellan Skarsgard and Pierfrancesco Favino

programme.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
programme.desc: Film-makers Andrew Jarecki and Marc Smerling examine the life of American property tycoon Robert Durst, who has been a suspect in the 1982 disappearance of his wife Kathie, the murder of his confidante Susan Berman and the killing and dismemberment of a neighbour in Galveston, Texas. Durst speaks about the accusations publicly for the first time and there are contributions by his second wife Debrah Lee Charatan and his brother Douglas, as well as from police officers and lawyers involved in the Galveston Bay investigation

programme.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst

programme.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
programme.desc: Film-makers Andrew Jarecki and Marc Smerling talk to property tycoon Robert Durst, who recalls the events of 2000, the year the investigation into the disappearance of his wife Kathie was reopened. It was also the year Susan Berman, the daughter of famous Las Vegas mobster David Berman, was murdered. Susan had become Dursts spokesperson following Kathies disappearance two decades earlier, but had been overlooked by investigators back in 1982. However, before the police were able to speak to her after the case was reopened, Susan was found shot in the back of the head. With no sign of a struggle at the crime scene, investigators surmised her killer was likely someone who knew her well, but they were unable to make a clear connection that linked Robert Durst to her death

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts shares the best archaeological discoveries of 2018, starting with the North of the UK and a preserved prehistoric village at the black Loch in Myrton. programme.title: Stargate Atlantis
programme.desc: In an episode set in an alternate reality, Sheppard is a homicide detective who joins forces with FBI agent Woolsey in pursuit of a serial killer terrorising Las Vegas. As each victim is discovered apparently drained of their life force, the investigators begin to realise the case is far more sinister than either of them had imagined

programme.title: Stargate Atlantis
programme.desc: The 100th and final episode of the sci-fi series. Todd informs Atlantis that a group of Wraith has several ZPMs in its possession to use to power a new superhive. When the crew reaches the hive, it does significant damage to the Daedalus and jumps into hyperspace - and the team discovers that the ship is heading to Earth

programme.title: Uptown Otters
programme.desc: Anna and her clan are back in Marina Bay, and while Mia hustles the Townies out of reach, the Nomads remain blissfully unaware of the impending conflict

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer makes an attempt to give Cupid a helping hand by arranging a date between Principal Skinner and Marges man-hungry sister Selma. Animated comedy, with the voices of Dan Castellaneta and Harry Shearer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer learns he has a long-lost half-brother and tracks him down to Detroit, where he is presented with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make something of himself. Featuring the guest voice of Danny DeVito

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarretts sister is arrested for smuggling blood diamonds worth $20million, prompting him to seek help in the setting up of a sting operation from an ex-con, who served 30 years in prison for a similar offence. Guest starring Ed Asner, who reprises a role he played in the original series in 1975

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates when a womans body is discovered in a drainage ditch, prompting Max to reveal details of his painful past in an effort to convince his colleagues that jailed killer the Trashman is responsible. Crime drama, starring Masi Oka and Alex OLoughlin

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: The day of Katsumotos hearing arrives and he learns if his career in law enforcement is over for good or not. Thomas and Higgins are hired to investigate a man their client believes committed murder

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: The team heads to Mexico to escort a fugitive back to the US, but things go awry and Hondo has to save an old witness tied to the case. Crime drama, starring Shemar Moore

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grampa Simpson falls in love with a woman at the rest home who later dies unexpectedly and leaves him $100,000. Understandably taken aback, he does not know what to do with his new-found wealth - but resolves not to share it with Homer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
programme.desc: When Bart is knocked down by Mr Burns car, Homer and lawyer Lionel Hutz see a chance to take advantage of Springfields richest man by making a lucrative compensation claim

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge is delighted to discover she still has a flair for art, and is commissioned to paint Mr Burnss portrait - much to Homers horror. With the guest voice of Ringo Starr

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa develops a crush on a new supply teacher at her school and develops an even greater enthusiasm for learning, while Bart runs against Martin for the position of class president - but makes the mistake of not voting in the election. Featuring the guest voice of Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Michael learns the Scranton branch faces closure and embarks on a quest to keep staff morale high

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: The Scranton and Stamford branches are merged, reuniting Jim and Pam after several months apart

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Global Adventure
programme.desc: Documentary capturing some of the greatest filming sequences of David Attenboroughs career, using previously unseen footage, from the deepest dives in a submersible on the Great Barrier Reef to watching a million bats take off in a cave in Borneo. Other highlights include life in the frozen tundra of South Georgia, a colony of King Penguins and the worlds largest migration of Hammerhead sharks in the Galapagos Islands

programme.title: The Sky Arts Awards
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Bailey hosts the ceremony from Londons Roundhouse, honouring excellence in dance, theatre, pop, TV drama, film, classical music, literature, poetry, opera, comedy and visual arts. Nominees include David Byrne, Jamie Hale and Barnsley-based company LUNG in the theatre category while the popular music category consists of nominees Charli xcx, Kneecap and Lola Young. The Literature category celebrates the work of Alan Hollinghurst, Gwyneth Lewis and Sally Rooney and shortlisted in the television category are Adolescence, Mr Loverman and Rivals

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Documentary following the Thames Valley Police as they use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented. The programme also features shocking footage of dangerous drivers

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The Korea Open. Coverage of day one of the WTA 500 event, a hard-court tournament at Seoul Olympic Park Tennis Center, featuring matches from the first round. British star Emma Raducanu was in action at this stage 12 months ago, and came through a challenging encounter against American Peyton Stearns, eventually winning 7-6, 7-6. Another British player, Heather Watson, also claimed a straight-set victory when she beat Chinas Lu Jiajing 6-4, 6-4

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Houston Texans v Tampa Bay Buccaneers (Kick-off 12.00am). Coverage of the week two match at NRG Stadium, as the hosts play their first home game of the season. These two sides last faced each other in 2023 in a thrilling match that ended in a 39-37 win for the Texans. Houston will be looking to improve on their performance in the 2024 season, when they reach the divisional play-offs before losing 23-14 to the Kansas City Chiefs

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Las Vegas Raiders v Los Angeles Chargers (Kick-off 3.00am). Coverage of the week two match at Allegiant Stadium. These two sides last met at the start of this year when the visitors came away with a 34-20 victory.

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The Korea Open. Coverage of day two of the WTA 500 event, a hard-court tournament at Seoul Olympic Park Tennis Center, where the first round is scheduled to continue. The corresponding stage of last years event saw the number six seed, Yulia Putintseva,suffer a 6-3, 7-6 loss to the unseeded Amanda Anisimova, while there was also disappointment for the home crowd as Jang Su-jeong lost in three sets to Ajla Tomljanovic

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary turns its attention away from Liverpools mothers-to-be, instead focusing on the roles the various boyfriends, fiances, partners and husbands play in the labour suite. Super-organised Paul, a risk manager by trade, impresses midwives when he plans out every detail of his wife Nadine birthing experience, right down to the music. Meanwhile, young parents-to-be Bobbilee and Frankie, who had only known each other for a month before Bobbi became pregnant, have a much more laissez-faire attitude to labour, one which is put to the ultimate test after 48 hours at the Womens Hospital. Finally, 32-year-old mum Linda faces bringing her baby into the world without the aid of her partner Tony, whose traumatic past experience of hospitals means he wont be accompanying her to theatre

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Warrington, Cheshire, to meet electrician Dave McCartney, a healthy man until he had a stroke at work that has left him partially paralysed. Now he is forced to sleep in a hospital bed in his kitchen - but it wont be for much longer, as his old workmates team up with the DIY SOS builders and other members of the local community to adapt his home to his needs, with designer Charlie Luxton on hand to keep the boys in check

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: As Sweet Week continues, the chefs enter the MasterChef kitchen to find colourful glistening gems sitting on stands - its a taste test, and each of the gems are made from jelly

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Documentary series following the paramedics of West Midlands Ambulance Service. Jamie and Debbie rush to an unconscious man in a diabetic coma

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: An overweight bulldog needs an operation on his knees, but first Noel and the team must fix his breathing defect - a a common problem with flat face breeds. Elsewhere, a pug requires risky emergency spinal surgery to remove a cyst, and a rescue dog with hip dysplasia may have to be let go while under anaesthetic

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick tries to save a tortoiseshell cats leg by cutting out a tumour that has developed and replacing its knee with a unique bionic implant. Staffordshire bull terrier Rosie is admitted as an emergency after her back legs suddenly collapse in the park, and Noel performs essential spinal surgery to the diseased discs in Rosies spine and advises a course of intense physiotherapy

programme.title: Dog School
programme.desc: A peek behind the fence at Bruces Doggy Day Care in Surrey and Dogs Country Club in Warrington, where dogs take part in activities from Doga to aromatherapy massage and good doggy football. Minnie the Rottweiler arrives at Dogs Country Club in Warrington, but needs to have her behaviour assessed by Zeus the Siberian Husky, who can spot an antisocial dog within minutes

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A woman gets caught on the wrong end of a fishing spear, theres a daring rescue at sea and a chopper crew welcomes a new life mid-flight

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers fly solo this week, giving them a chance to demonstrate their individual abilities as they transform shepherd huts into boutique boltholes on a glampsite in north Wales. The client is a brand-new business so they have a blank canvas to work on, and having been given individual briefs by Michelle Ogundehin, each designer takes a different approach to turning these tiny spaces into luxury living accommodation, with the challenge of an en-suite shower room and an outdoor space thrown in for good measure. What will Michelle and guest judge Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen make of the end results?

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermos most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant decor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Womens Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. The pair hope Petes brain injury will not stop him from being able to recall this memorable moment in the future. Also featured is third-time mother Lisa, whose previous two labours only lasted six and four hours respectively, and former drama school student Hayley, who already has children with her other-half Stephen, and has resolved to appreciate every moment with her family after losing her own mother at an early age

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Orpington, south-east London, to meet hospital worker Jason Sulong, who was involved in a motorcycle accident that left him partially paralysed. Now he is unable to climb the stairs in his home and has difficulty accessing his bathroom and washing facilities, so designer Gabrielle Blackman teams up with the DIY SOS builders and other members of the local community to work to adapt his home to his needs over the course of just nine days

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: As Sweet Week draws to a close, the remaining chefs are tasked with creating a nostalgic dish that transports the judges back in time and makes them feel like kids again

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins and theres a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to Americas west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigellas home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Womens Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Womens Hospital opens its doors to 16-year-old Heidi, who is accompanied by her own mum Jo, and Adele, the mother of the babys father, who has decided to take her sons place in the delivery room. Dad-to-be Gavin hopes poetry will help his jittery wife Michelle get through giving birth to their second child, and 46-year-old Jane finds herself laughing through her daughter Louises contractions as a means of coping with the stress of being a birthing partner

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A boater jumps through a fireball after a gas explosion, a hunter has a heart attack, and fishermen get some much-needed advice

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A mother and her unborn baby are at risk, adventure biking in the Marlborough Sounds causes a nasty injury, and a Land SAR team saves the day

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Chichester, West Sussex, where he encounters an Edwardian motoring duo patronised by King Edward VII. After a grand tour of their factory, he is treated to some rest and relaxation in one of their finest vehicles. Arriving in the resort of Southsea, Hampshire, Michael heads for the Kings Theatre, where he treads the boards in a community production of Lads in the Village. Crossing the Solent, the presenter boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage, then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from the coalfields of South Wales to the southernmost tip of Cornwall, travelling from Whitland, Carmarthenshire, to Swansea

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Pontyclun to Ebbw Vale in Wales. Along the way, he visits the Royal Mint in Llantrisant and Cardiff Arms Park, scene of the first Welsh victory over the All Blacks back in 1905. In Cardiff Bay, Michael discovers the departure point for one of the Edwardian eras most famous expeditions - Scotts ill-fated voyage to the Antarctic

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads off to collect some vintage motorcycles from a garage at the bottom of the garden in the North-East of England

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Derek has his work cut out trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting the garage roof. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary examining how Hitler and the Nazi party rose to power in Germany during the 1930s, revealing the greed, manipulation and frightening underestimation of Adolf Hitlers ambition. In 1930, Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law, but just four years later its leader was a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. Leading historians and experts take viewers inside the minds of those hellbent on gaining power and those who tried to stop them. First broadcast in 1997

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: In Kursk, a battlefield the size of Wales, the tide turns, and the Soviets push back, but as Germany retreats, they destroy all evidence of their genocidal activities

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Belton House in Lincolnshire. Items include a ceramic model of London Zoos first elephant from the late 19th century, an engraved glass vase won at a fair in the 1920s, a collection of memorabilia relating to the Duke of Windsor and a childrens chair in the shape of a starfish. Theres also an interview with Professor Timon Screech about Britains centuries of trade with Japan, accompanied by an ornate lacquer chest that may have arrived with the first shipment of Japanese treasures in 1614

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team find a few treasures at Lowther Castle in Cumbria, including a 19th-century toy steamboat, a saucy illustration by English artist Lawson Wood, a lipstick and compact set evoking the glamour of 1920s Manhattan, and a rare letter providing a first-hand account of the 1916 Easter Rising in Ireland. Theres also another chance to meet Bess, a stuffed dog with an aristocratic pedigree first featured on the show in 2011

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team invest in a piece of French art this week - a 1971 Citroen DS21 Pallas

programme.title: Tropic of Cancer with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The third leg of Simons journey takes him from the banks of the Nile to the edge of the Indian Ocean in Oman. Along the way he is introduced to Nubians displaced by the formation of Lake Nasser in the 1960s and nomadic Bedouins who have been forced to move by a seven-year drought scientists believe is due to climate change. On Egypts southern coast, he dives in pristine coral reefs, before seeing the unexpected sides of Saudi Arabian life

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Adventurer Simon Reeve sets out to travel around the coastline of the Indian Ocean, journeying by boat, car, train and plane as he takes in 16 countries. He starts on the tip of South Africa, where he dives with ragged-tooth sharks and joins conservationists helping to save the endangered African penguin, before heading into Cape Town, where he has a close encounter with a drug dealer. Moving on, he hitches a boat to Mozambique, where a nervous captain reveals the threat posed by Somali pirates, and completes this leg of his journey in Zanzibar, a tropical island steeped in the long history of the slave trade

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the Russian Revolution, adventurer Simon Reeve embarks on a journey across the worlds biggest country. He begins in Russias far east, and the snow-capped volcanoes of Kamchatka and Yakutia, where reindeer herders live in temperatures as low as minus 30. Outside the eastern port of Vladivostok, Simon investigates the growing influence of China on the area, then passes through the Boreal Forest, where he meets a conservationist dedicated to protecting the Amur tiger. His final destination is a giant hole in the ground in Siberia

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Newport, Gwent, where he learns about the heroism of a young boy who was awarded the Albert Medal, before visiting a cinema dating from 1912 in Clevedon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Taunton and Newton Abbot. Along the way he joins in with a fertility dance in Stogumber, visits a celebrated garden at Hestercombe to discover the fruits of an unusual partnership, and enjoys a trip aboard the longest heritage line in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the trail of an historic achievement made at the dawn of the Edwardian era, Michael Portillo investigates the first radio signal to be sent across the Atlantic. Then, in Plymouth, he uncovers what happened to surviving crew members of the most famous ocean liner in history, the Titanic. Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from East Yorkshire to Caernarfon, beginning by travelling from the city of Hull to the North Yorkshire market town of Malton

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.sub-title: The First Six Months in Power
programme.desc: It is 1933 and Adolf Hitler is the chancellor of Germany, but he does not have absolute power as there is still a democratic parliament, a head of state and the rule of law. Hitler calls a general election to increase Nazi representation, but a fire in the Reichstag building is blamed on communists - prompting thousands of arrests of left-wingers. Hitler then calls on President von Hindenburg to act and a decree is passed giving the Nazis emergency powers to ban free speech and the right to protest

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: Hitlers War moves to its endgame as the Soviets cross the German border - with a death toll of over 40 million, a new, scarred Europe will emerge

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team pay a second visit to Lowther Castle in Cumbria, where items include an army of Action Man figures, a skeletonised pendulum wall clock from the 1870s, a working child-sized car from the 1930s and a ring containing a gem that may or may not be worth a small fortune. Theres also an insight into Beatrix Potters scientific watercolours of woodland plants and animals - and her controversial work on the sex life of fungi

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum in Glasgow, where discoveries include jewellery made of mounted insects, a rare silver cup dating back to the time of Oliver Cromwell and a claymore sword from the Boer War. Other highlights include a large glass vase converted to a lamp, treasured childrens annuals featuring beloved Scottish character Oor Wullie and portraits linked to the Glasgow Boys school of artists

programme.desc: The team explore whether one wheel fewer means cheaper bills as they take on a three-wheeled wonder, the Reliant Robin

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Real Madrid v Marseille (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the matchday one fixture, held at the Bernabeu.
